I know many cases of hardship amongst .such people and I shall cite a typical example. Two young men, the only children of their parents, were killed' on service. They had contributed substantially to the family income, and their allotments were paid to the parents while they were on service. When they were killed, the parents were notined by the Repatriation Commission that they could apply for a pension.
